reviewText:
I do not understand the bad reviews on this game at all.

The game is slick and focus' on telling a story about two murdering, arms dealer scumbags in shanghai. Focusing on a single gameplay element which is cover based/run and gun third person shooting.

The cover system works like any other game as far as I could tell press a button to snap to cover, press the button or movement, the default button is C which is annoying you can change it in the config.

The shaky camera didn't both me, mosts of the time I liked it, if you don't you can also turn 'steadycam' on.

The story is dark and brutal, the proganists are prposely unlike scumbags and it's brillant because even when you die you're thinking the worlds probably better off without these guys anyway. It's one of the few games where you play the bad guy and it's fun.

don't let my logged game hours fool you, I've probably replayed 20-30 times

Pro's

graphics are still great
story is dark and intense
gameplay is simple and fun
runs on almost any machine from the last 4 -5 years
The first game is also awesome for all the same reasons

Con's

The final level and ending is anti climatic

Lots of people gave bad reviews about it largely complaining about camera and control schemes than can easily be configured from the in game menu.

reviewText:
Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is by far the hardest review I had to do. Not because it proved difficult to analyse or form an opinion of, but because it teases me with something that could have been great - yet is not. I don't like destroying a game I have a thing for, even though it's just on paper in the shape of a review, but there's no going around it. The franchise screams for a more flexible versatile game but instead I'm left with a repetitive hallway shooter.

Adam 'Kane', as ex-mercenary, and James 'Lynch', as felon convicted of manslaughter, form a crime duo to arrange an arms deal in Shanghai. However, sh¡t hits the fan and Kane accidentally shoots the informant's girlfriend. Unfortunately she turns out to have been the daughter of some thé mobster in Shanghai all of China, whom is not fond of his daughter dying from a bullet Kane fired. The game follows our protagonists through Shanghai as this crime lord throws in everything at his disposal as a means of revenge, which is a lot. From local thug to police officer, a few military companies to several special forces, this guy has them all in his pocket and intends to use every man to kill Kane and Lynch.

There really is nothing wrong with the writing, and reading about Kane & Lynch (either of the two parts) will want to make you play the games. The protagonist duo have a background together (as portrayed in Kane & Lynch: Dead Men) which - coupled with their voice actors - look like cold hard m☮therfµckers. There's no other way to describe them. This is actually necessary to make their survival credible as far as the setting is concerned, and it does add up.

Though what doesn't add up is everything around it, with the partial exception of screenwriting: since the fundamentals of Dog Days is its hallway shooter mechanic, there isn't much freedom for screenwriting to begin with. The scenarios are heavily constrained to these mechanics and it doesn't take long for an observant player to notice that the intended storyline doesn't carry over as strong as it could have with different mechanics. The attempt is very admirable however, as even though some scenes are incredibly violent, they never feel forced or out of place.

The graphical quality is above average, though the used shaders and camera movement prove to be rather annoying over time. The bobbing, lens flares and shaders look great when only observed, but when you are in control of the camera yourself it quickly feels as if the game consistently misinterprets movements. There are glitches involved as well, though this might have to do with the fact that Dog Days is an older game and my newer hardware might not render some things correctly.

The sounds are too diverse to criticize in general. On one hand there are flat unconvincing gunshots, average ambience and mediocre soundeffects. On the other hand there's the convincing gritty voices of Kane and Lynch. While dialogue is well dosed, a great majority of the game still consists of shooting and as such there is little the dialogue of Kane and Lynch can do to make the game sound better in overall.

All of these assets could be worked with if it weren't for the repetitive hallway shooter mechanics. All details aside, this game is mainly about sitting behind cover, shooting people that are also behind cover, and moving up through the predefined path. The entirety of the game is played like this while every now and then a cutscene plays. The motives behind these mechanics might have to do with the developers intending to reach maximum cinematic experience by constraining the player, but when a game starts to feel like something that can be played on an light-gun arcade cabinet - graphics aside - a lot of players are going to conclude the game is boring without ever finishing the first playthrough.

And that's a shame because just the storyline, the strong characters being coupled with great voices, and the potential hidden in screenwriting makes this game a hidden gem. My conclusion is that it's definitely worth a play, Dog Days is truly different from a great majority of titles and a developer's second attempt to bring a franchise to life that is much more potent than the games are willing to show. While compelling story-wise, the gameplay itself will most likely bore you. In that regard it's funny how Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is only three to four hours worth of playtime, because anything more would have been too much in its current form. Collectors will probably not mind putting down €10,- for this, and I would plead the same for gamers with a thing for mentionable titles. If you are on a tight budget and have no idea about what I'm trying to unveil with my review, then you wouldn't be able to appreciate the title(s) and it's best to stay away from the franchise.

I'm clicking the thumbs up for this game here because as broken as it might be: I admire the story, characters and voices, three things I value. Someday I will try the first Kane & Lynch and I'm also hoping the scheduled movie isn't going to ruin the franchise even more.

reviewText: If you can look past bugs, textures, enemy AI, and the cover system. You'll find a game that clearly had a lot of love put into it, unfortunately, the budget given to them didn't allow for the full picture.\n\nI would definitely recommend picking this up whenever it's next on sale. If you keep in mind that this is a low budget title, you might be surprised what you find. It probably has the most unique soundtrack for a shooter you're likely to find. It really helps punctuate the main-character's mental illness and the insanity of the events that unfold over the course of the game's story.

reviewText:
Finishing Kane & Lych 2 feels like when you wake up from a horrible nightmare. You'll feel tired, with a headache, disoriented, trying to understand what just happened, trying to make some sense out of it.
It took me a while to realize that despite all the flaws that the game has concerning the shooting and cover mechanics, it succeeds in delivering a nauseating and nightmarish experience.
The dark, dirty and repulsive places that you visit, the amateur camcorder camera style, the convoluted storyline and characters and the unexpected and inconclusive cliffhanger ending all work together to make playing this game a nauseating and repulsive endeavour.
Most critics" failed to understand that Kane & Lynch 2 is an ugly and disgusting game because it was designed to look like that. This is a game for those of us who "just want to watch the world burn"."

reviewText:
Very underrated series. I love the feeling, setting, sound and characters of Kane & Lynch. Even though the gameplay is not the greatest, it is still worth playing just for those. It is very dark, depressing and the youtube like format of the grainy camera fits perfectly. Imo it is worth buying just for the menu screen! Best menu screens ever!
Some of the scenes in the game also feel very unsettling thanks to the music design. Especially a shootout early in the game where police sirens is mixed into the sound and music makes for a very nice, hopeless and unsettling feeling.

I would love for Rockstar to get involved in Kane & Lynch. It would fit their style perfectly. If they can just keep the feeling but polish up the gameplay it could be truly amazing.

Gameplay: 7/10
Overall: 9/10

reviewText:
If Gaspar Noe made a game it would probably be this, pure sensory abuse from beginning to end. A fast nightmare of car alarms, blinking lights and a drone soundtrack that really puts you into the head of its schizophrenic title character.

Its basically Spec Ops: The Line if it didnt treat you like a ♥♥♥♥♥. Play it, its only about 3 hours long and is a genuinely unforgettable experience. Also features probably some of the best visual and sound design I have ever seen in a game.

Theres never going to be another Triple A game that delights in alienating its audience as much as this one did.

reviewText: You're running starkers through a city, your skin cut to pieces, a gun in your hand. Your buddy is also naked and bleeding from numerous wounds all over his body. This is the crazy life of Kane and Lynch, gaming's most unlikable leading men; psychos who just can't stay out of trouble. With the original game failing to be a critical success, developer IO Interactive's sequel has a lot to prove.Without spoiling the plot of this sequel too much, Kane and Lynch bodge a job, resulting in the death of someone with connections to a huge criminal organisation in Shanghai. With an army of goons out for blood what follows is an often unpleasant tale of revenge, torture, murder and the ramblings of a psycho and his mate. This time around you play as Lynch, although the slightly less unhinged, but still more or less a psycho, Kane is always at your side.Dog Days is, at its core, a fairly simplistic cover-based third-person shooter. You can now hide behind objects by pressing a button, rather than the awkward auto cover system the original game employed, and the controls feel tighter too. Environments this time around have been designed to allow for better use of these basic mechanics.With enemies dropping guns and ammo all over the place, and a plentiful supply of explosive canisters and crates, you're never short of ways to dispose of foes.The duo's fairly brief murderous adventure is unquestionably full of intense shoot-outs, but memorable moments are few and far between. The naked scene alluded to at the start doesn't deliver anything new in terms of gameplay, but the events were shocking enough to make me feel a bit uneasy. Equally, a level set inside an office block under attack from a gunship is full of things being shot to pieces, but it still somehow lacks spectacle.Dingy levels merge into one rather depressing whole, with the various Shanghai environments doing little to sell the Chinese city as a hot tourist destination.Audio work is rather impressive, with the excellent voice acting paired superbly with ambient sounds from the city. Fire fights send bullets ricocheting through your surround sound speakers, while our heroes constantly bicker with each other. The lip synching could certainly have been better, but on the whole the performances of each virtual actor make a basic story very entertaining.Sadly very little is made of main protagonist Lynch's mental state. He's almost always shouting something that only an unhinged man would, but his unique characteristics don't translate into the gameplay.A rather unsatisfactory ending to the psychotic double act's ordeal sours things somewhat. I was left expecting the pair to return to the screen after the closing credits, but there was nothing of the sort.Co-op play, via split-screen or online, adds in an element of working together, but the only differences are enhanced flanking abilities and being able to revive your buddy if he's downed by enemy fire. Split-screen is also vastly inferior to online co-op.The campaign feels a few hours short, but you do get a very decent multiplayer component, with game modes that test your skill with weapons as much as they do your morals.Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is a visually unique title, glossing over a fairly by the numbers third-person shooter. The deranged duo's return is worth experiencing and is far more accomplished than its predecessor, but the gameplay on offer still doesn't match the quality of the characters IO has created.

reviewText: Extremely misunderstood game.  It was clearly made as an artistic demonstration.  Most game characters are murderous during gameplay but heroic in cutscenes conveniently ignoring the fact that they've just killed hundreds of people.  Kane and Lynch are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s through and through.  Just thoroughly dislikeable people.  And this game is about a ♥♥♥♥ed up situation that they get stuck in and try to get out of, but everything just keeps going from bad to worse.  The visuals are intentionally disgusting with glaring lens flare, harsh neon and pixellation all designed to emphasise how messy the situation is.  The combat is also not the smoothest with you easily getting knocked down on your ♥♥♥ all adding up to what a total ♥♥♥♥ storm of a mess this tale is.\n\nA revolting hot mess of parts that somehow comes together as a great experience overall.  Be prepared to be disgusted and best played co-op with a friend.

reviewText:
THE DOWNLOW:
Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is another third person corridor shooter with cover mechanics.  It comprises of a single 11 mission campaign based on a fictional representation of Shanghai, China. The campaign can be played solo or with another player.  There are also three online coop and pvp player-modes: Fragile Alliance: free-for-all team-based robbery missions, Undercover Cop: FA w/ a hidden infiltrator twist and Cops & Robbers: Up to 6vs6 shootout and escape or die.

THE GOOD:
+ A well established story in the mould of HEAT. Great if you loved the movie and want to play something akin to it.
+ Take on the role of two great characters with striking personalities.
+ Top-notch voice-overs which bring them to life. Compliments the action perfectly with some great dialogue.
+ A very good selection of weapons provides decent variety in your play-style.  Limited to two weapons at any one time.
+ Some great fast-paced action, gratifying kills and gory takedowns.
+ The enemy A.I on the second hardest difficulty presents a great challenge if you are into hardcore shooters.  On the hardest difficulty it is even more of a ♥♥♥♥♥!

THE BAD:
- Levels are linear and undynamic in content.  Once you play it through, follow-ups will be essentially the same.
- On the hardest difficulty even being in cover doesnt necessarily mean you are safe!
- Flaky keyboard controls means you can leave cover unexpectedly and die.  Moreso on highest difficulty.
- Multiplayer needs at least 2vs2 players for FA & UC modes and 3vs3 for C&R.  Which is extremely difficult given that MP is virtually dead except for a few random players.  Moreso as some achievements require all players to have the Doggie Bag (map) DLC.
- Head-bobbing together with a bad camera angle may make you travel-sick, when running!
- Experienced a few crashes in singleplayer.
- MP can suffer from lag though I think this is a memory leak and just needs a game restart.
- Online modes are hampered with a terrible graphical glitch that sometimes also requires a restart.
- A problem with owners of the Doggie Bag DLC not being able to play a map was fixed in a patch.
- Achievements cannot be 100%d because of one broken achievement.  'Harry Houdini' was likely broken in a botched patch after release.  Believe me I tested this substantially and was unable to trigger it!
- Requires purchase of Doggie Bag DLC to get [nearly all] achievements.
- You will need a very capable partner to complete the game at its highest difficulty.  Unless you are Chuck Norris. :)
- I still dont know why they censored the gory details of dead bodies.... maybe a Germany thing!

AND THE ORDINARY:
* Levels are essentially enclosed areas with limited movement options.
* Decent cover mechanics but limited tactical gameplay mostly centred on pinning and flanking, taking the high-ground, feinting, or flushing enemies out of cover.
* Level design is basic with only the location setting changing between each one.
* Enemies range between law enforcement(mainly cops) and other villians.  As usual health and weaponary are the only thing that really differenciates between them.
* AAA graphics that were probably great at the time.  Look a little dated now but still very good.
* The campaign is certainly replayable.  I finished it solo and then completed it on the hardest difficulty with another player. Campaign will take around 15-20 hours.
* Longevity is focused on multi-player which is actually great fun but difficult to get enough players at the same time.

VERDICT:
Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is a very capable third-person shooter.  It captures your interest with some very visceral gunfights.  Without doubt despite the repetitive nature of its gameplay, its replayable numerous times.  Even for someone who doesnt like MP/PvP, online sessions are very short and you dont lose anything but some time if you are defeated.

I enjoyed playing this game. You will enjoy it too if you are a fan of the film HEAT, where this game generates a similar & familiar feeling.  If you prefer open-world games then maybe avoid it.  Also if you like to achieve 100% achievements and don't use SAM.  Just be warned that the camera angle and bobbing perspective isnt for everyone.  Its just a shame that the online side of the game is virtually dead.

reviewText:
I was quite surprised with this game. The story gets dark in terms of graphic violence very fast and never lets up. There are scene skips between waypoints I felt where the game was rushed and should have included transition pieces to make it flow smoother (such as a certain mission where you are trying to reunite with another group, reach the waypoint, then jumpcut to standing right next to them). Altogether the actual story portion was short and sweet, leaving a satisfactory feeling for about 4 hours of content. I did have 3 crashes in game and it was the game itself, no need to reset my computer or anything like that.

I recommend playing it on easy or medium as the guns are mostly inaccurate, even when trying to fire single shots. You will often die to random headshots that cannot be controlled even when in cover on harder difficulties, so it will be mostly frustrating than tactical fun. Thankfully the camera angle can be changed on the fly, making it playable in certain environments like tight corners when the enemy has high firepower to potentially take you down fast.

Online Co-OP worked very well. Me and a friend had no issues joining each other's game for the story mode. I haven't tried the multiplayer version yet because I don't like game modes that reward antisocial behavior in a team. Since it is a game, there will be somebody that betrays the group and it puts unneeded pressure in completing objectives. If you have a group of friends who aren't D-bags, then give it a go, otherwise, be cautious.

After beating this on normal difficulty and expert, I'll probably never touch this game again, but I had a great and memorable reaction to the story and recommend fans of dark and semi-realistic stories to try it when on sale.

reviewText: Terrible, TERRIBLE game. Although graphics are nice and I salute the effort it must have taken to emulate the handy cam, this game is just half baked. The cover system is broken but above all, the aiming system is awful. You can unload clips on an enemy that is 5 feet away and spray your bullets all over without a single hit. However, the enemies have dead aim at 500 feet, killing you almost instantly and they can take 4-5 bullets in the head without dying. They can also shoot you accurately hitting 90% of their shots while blind shooting from cover. And I played on easy... You survive between 5 and 30 seconds and then restart over and over again until you get so frustrated that you just dump the stupid game. Kane & Lynch? Dead men for sure!

reviewText: At first I really liked this game, but the aiming is so broken beyond repair. I'm not talking about going full auto on a 10m away enemy and miss every shot (that's of course understandable). I'm talking about unloading all the shotgun shells on an enemy at a point blank range and he wasn't even scratched - I got killed instead. Tested repeatedly on the same enemy, I always consistently missed point blank shots. This is not realistic shooting anymore, this is broken shooting and it's irritating me. I had to stop playing after like the second level or so (the first level doesn't seem to suffer from this erroneous aim issue) I was looking for fun, not annoyance.\n\nFor those who complained about shaky camera, there's a setting to turn this off in Controls". This game has issues
date: but shaky camera isn't one of them."

reviewText:
Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days

Positives:

+ Decent graphics, but nothing amazing.
+ Arsenal of weapons to use throughout the game, such as uzi's, shotguns and a variety of military grade assault rifles, along with pistols.
+ This entire game is action, with frequent shootouts and some intense cutscenes (although these are all too rare). As a result of this non-stop combat you do feel engaged in the game.
+ Various parts of the environment are destructible, and become damaged amidst the firefights Kane and Lynch are involved in.


Negatives:

- The story is lacklustre in comparison to Kane and Lynch: Dead Men (the original). The characters themselves feel dull and the interesting aspects of their personality are absent in this game. The story is straightforward and doesn't have any complexity to it.
- The main campaign takes about 3-4 hours. It would definitely be longer on the highest difficulty but still nowhere near long enough.
- While the constant shootouts in this game can be viewed positively, it also becomes so common  that it loses its charm.
- The new arcade mode is boring and repetitive. If you like to unlock achievements this is a grind. You join a team of AI criminals where you execute a heist to steal cash or other valuables, then shoot your way to the escape vehicle. After you become accustomed to the different maps (which are nicely thought-out I shoud add), you just repeat them over and over to gain ranks and access to different weapons. Not fun.

Overall Score: 5.0/10

Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is ideal for an afternoon playthrough when you have nothing else to do. A short game filled with action and a story which isn't quite in-depth enough to be captivating. It features some cutscenes which will move you, but in the end falls short in many areas.

Only grab it very cheap on sale like I did.
voteText: 26 of 44 people (59%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Despite its infamy, it's mostly more of the same generic 3rd person cover shooter, but this time you're in control of Lynch, the crazier of the two bad guys. I felt that there were no levels as good as the great ones in K&L 1, but also none that were as bad as the worst ones.

It's a really, really short game, so I wanted to know the launch price and after some Googling and Archive.org-ing I found that it was $49.99 O_O and I think that really helped this game's bad reputation as this really felt like it should've launched in the same price range as CoJ: Gunslinger of FC: Blood Dragon. Not that it's as good as Gunslinger, no. It's not even close. But it's not that catastrophic.

I think it's worth it to play this once if you like unlikable (uhh, is that possible? you know what I mean) protagonists and want to see them screw up and get themselves into another bad situation.

One thing I didn't like is the stylistic choice of having headshots 'censored' by the pixel thingie. I guess it was supposed to show you the violence through the eyes of an unrepentant psychopath, but it got old really quick.


rating - 3 silver sloths

reviewText:
In Kane & Lynch: Dead Men, Lynch was schizophreniac. Since he has a chinese girlfriend he doesn't need to take pills anymore. But then Kane came back in his life and ruined everything.

Running naked with scars all over the body is what Co-op gaming in Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is about. Don't mind the shaky video cam and the censorship.

Start a Co-op game and crank up the game difficulty to Extreme. And see how fair the game is :
- 5 seconds to revive your teammate...
- Broken cover system...
- Low accuracy weapons...
- Inconsistent damage output...

Really hard to imagine this game was made by the team who made the Hitman series...

reviewText:
Although Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days from IO Interactive has a distinct visual style, the other parts of the game never branch out in any interesting or different ways, and made worse by the shockingly brief 3-5 hour single-player campaign.

The best part of Dog Days is the visual style. The game is shot like you are looking through a handheld camera. Although you can turn on steady cam for anyone prone to motion sickness, the rest of the effects cannot be turned off. This is a welcome change. Most games allow you to turn off their effects, I appreciated that Dog Days had a vision and stuck too it with this game.

While the visual style is distinct, unfortunately the other parts of the game are not. It's a standard cover based third person shooter, the story did enough to keep me wanting to see how it played out, despite the fair amount of cliches, such as Kane talking about this being his last job, or one the characters literally saying I'm too old for this".

The game is also incredibly short
date: it took me just under 4 hours to finish the single-player campaign on medium. Even though their is multiplayer
recommended: I was unable to find any ranked or player matches.\n\nUltimately Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is a flawed game
hoursPlayed: the visual style is very unique
voteText: but goes to waste in a game that is not that much fun to play."

reviewText: Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is much better than the first game. However, I still cannot recommend the game due to the extremely short story (<3 hours to complete) which makes no sense, insanely shakey camera (you need to turn on SteadyCam to remove), and the unnecessary full screen effects and filters (you can also turn this off under Video options), and no attempt whatsoever to develop the story or the characters. It appears the characters have had their personalities changed" from the first game and there's very little mention of actions from the first game. It's almost like they took the characters and just put them in a whole new game without any care about the first game. The graphics and gameplay this time is much better
date: however there's simply not enough content in this game to keep people interested. The story is forgettable where you just run around Shanghai killing everyone for no reason and the arcade mode/multi-player is fun the first time around and then you realize it's essentially PayDay."

reviewText:
If you ever wished you were a sad middle-aged balding man who shot his way through China, this is the game for you. You are not a fit muscular man with impeccable reflexes and cool gadgets. You don't have space for a thousand rounds of ammo. You cannot hang from ledges and execute cool take down moves. You barely have clothes on some levels as shielding. There is you, your buddy and some guns, and lots of Chinese people who apparently have taken it upon themselves to kill you.

I watch Dexter, I've played through some disturbing games, but this game takes gritty realist discomfort to another level. I would have to stop in between levels just because the gritty realism was too much for me.

Another point, though I am not Chinese, is that I was somewhat uncomfortable with the way the makers portrayed China, chinese people and treated the lives of chinese people as valueless. But thats video games for you.

reviewText: It's a fun, action packed game that has a short but compeling story if you pay attention to it.\nI finished the game in one go with a friend over co-op, the campaign lasts about 4 hours.The arcade mode is fun and gives the game an hour more if you want to get more time out of the game. On the multiplayer side it sounds and looks great, but there are no servers or players that you can find. During the co-op campaign I've experienced shaky player animations that weren't a problem, but brought a few laughs here and there. For those that have problems with the shaky camera and the grain effect, you can turn that off in the options menu. To summarize it's a medicore game with a few problems here and there, but it pulls through with its fun action packed gameplay, and story. I rate this game 6 out of 10.

reviewText: This game could have been much better.\nFirst of all, let me highlight positive sides of the game (potential spoiler here). It has intensity and is pretty atmospheric. You are not playing as some badass heroes fighting for just cause. Kane and Lynch were complete bаstards in the first game, and they remain being themselves in this sequel. And even those attempts of Lynch to save his girlfriend don't change fact: he and Kane lack pretty much every good moral side that any normal person has. This makes you feel the originality of the game, as it clearly doesn't have modern popular action game cliches.\nBut still, I can hardly recommend this game to anyone. I could barely follow the plot of the game, as it is unclear. Most of the time you are simply forced to survive in unending street gang and police gunfire. reviewText:
I got this off the Humble bundle and I played around until I got really ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and stopped. If you get this in a pack of games on the cheap and don't mind a 3rd person game with weird shooting - get it. Otherwise give it a pass.

Pros:
- The presentation is awesome
- Kane and Lynch
- Shanghai

Cons:
- The gunplay is beyond broken: hit detection is wack, recoil is over the top non-realistic (it goes all over the place even when I fire in bursts with an AK-like weapon, cmon)
- The cover system is really a hit and miss: sometimes it'd get you stuck, sometimes you won't be able to get into cover and sometimes enemies somehow shoot you through a few layers of cover from an impossible angle
- Enemy AI seems to hit me from across the level with an uzi / pistol, but when I shoot dead at them I get no hit markers nothing, with any weapon other than the sniper (which also doesn't work at times)
- Friendly AI is complete garbage, often taking vital cover and leaving you completely vulnrable out in the open...this might be a level problem too, now that I think about it
- Friendly AI's aim is...just as good as...VHS amateur porn from the 80s
- On the sections where you and your Friendly AI partner are supposed to split into a two-lane style level the Friendly AI doesn't shoot the targets on its lane and they start shooting at you, and since it's a corridor where you're exposed from practically over 180C you get insta-slaughtered in no time

reviewText:
I loved the original Kane&Lynch when I first bought it for the xbox 360. I had never bothered with the sequel since I kept hearing so many negative opinions
Whoo boy were they right.
The original game had a fairly interesting story to it and the action scenes were fun. From escaping a robbing a bank to rappeling down a skyscraper, it had me feeling like I was playing the video game version of 'Heat'. This game felt like a nonstop series of hallways and alleyways. Hallways in apartments, hallways in warehouses, hallways in airports.
The one thing I did enjoy about this game was the whole handicam aesthetic. Its gimmicky and I had to turn off the shakycam sprinting but otherwise I liked the muddy noises and visual artifacts. Too bad it didnt cover up all of the awful bugs in this game.

reviewText:
Have you ever thought about taking on the Hong Kong underworld in a quest for vengeance, money and lost love? Well then this might be the game for you.

This game takes everything the predecessor did and improves upon it immensely. The game play is much more responsive and fluid. The array of weaponry at your disposal really packs a punch adding to the heart pounding action you find from pretty much constant shoot outs.

The story is winding and epic, with many great set pieces and extended firefights. The environments are more vivid and feel alive. The whole game takes place throughout Shanghai, from slums to sky scrapers each level feels unique and feels totally different. The characters are much more fleshed out and defined, there isn’t a huge cast of secondary characters but this game is focused almost exclusively on the main duo and their exploits in a very short period of time.

I like this game and I had a good time working my way through everything. It is not the best game I have ever played but I did have a better time with it than the original. The one drawback is the sudden ending, but right up to that point everything was pretty solid.

I would recommend this over the original but I still can’t recommend this at full price. Pick this up on sale, play it for a while but don’t bother completing it as you will be left with a bittersweet taste.

Have fun ^_^

reviewText:
Bland, unoriginal, uninspired.

Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is exactly how you shouldn't do a sequel and why you shouldn't do a sequel to a bad game anyway. The worst thing about it has to be the use of the awkward Youtube filter, it blurs the visuals and makes what could of been a visually superb game into a grotesque being equivilent of Katie Price. Ultimately this Gears clone lacks any sort of a substance. Kane & Lynch 2 has a weak story, weaker characterisation and is an unrewarding experience all in all. Levels grow repetitive fast, cover doesn't actually work and online co-op is laggy even on a solid connection.

Please, please, please avoid Kane & Lynch 2. IO Interactive, it's developers, are capable of more - their work on Freedom Fighters and Hitman is evidence of this. As attractive as Kane and Lynch 2 may seem, especially for it's low cost price tag, the game is worth no attention.

reviewText:
Kane & Lynch 2: We should have stopped at one
The first thing I noticed with this game, was a headache. I mean, the shaky cam gave me a headache, and for the first time in my life I got to experience motion sickness. Once I figured out where they hid the option for the shaky cam (hint: it's in the controls section), I finished the main game in only 3 hours... without rushing.

The main story revolves around Kane and Lynch getting together for one more job. Everything goes to hell, and you shoot your way out. That is pretty much the whole story, right there. I wish I was kidding right now.

The game was short, repetitive, and for the most part, downright awful. Aiming sucked, the cover-based mechanics were sub-par, and the story was nowhere to be found. The graphics, while alright in some places, were stitched together with overused lighting effects, and what J. J. Abrams would consider to be too many lens flares. This was likely used in an attempt to hide their rushed graphics.

They also do this weird thing in the game where they censor headshots... you shoot someone in the head, a big blur spot appears and breaks immersion. If you want to kill a game, this is a good place to start. Was it supposed to be artistic, like the shaky cam?

I'm really not sure there is much to recommend with this game, I barely stuck with it long enough to finish it.

Graphics: 6/10 (once you turn off shaky cam)
Story: 2/10 (Hey, we're shooting people... that's a story, right?)
Gameplay: 5/10 (it was playable, not much else)
Overall: ... 3/10? I don't know, the game sucked and caused me physical pain from trying to play it.

Not recommended.

reviewText: This is a really cool and stylized thrird-person shooter.  The game takes place from the perspective of Lynch and if you can find someone to play with you can get a very Dead Space 3 type game in which Lynch is having delusions that Kane cannot see.  Dog Days is really interesting because you are throwsn into a gang war right from the start.  The camera is really well done in a modern reality T.V. type perspective as though it is a camera person following you around.  This leads to the action feeling appropriately jarring and disorienting.  I'm really enjoying this so far and find it to be a huge improvement over the forst game.  Definitely check this out and get a friend to play with if possible.

reviewText:
Most of film directors and film studios are professional in specific genre(s). It usualy does'nt work when a famous director who makes horror films, leaves his major genre to make movies in different genre, for example comedy. It would be interesting to see their effort in different fields but just for a test. It would take so much time and effort if Rockstar want to leave open world games to develop a FPS like COD and I believe it won't be a good game, atleast not like COD.

I wrote all the description above to say it dose'nt work for IO interactive too. When they developed the first Kane and Lynch, I played it and it was obvious that the game is'nt a good Third Person Shooter. I found that IO is not a good shooter developer and they should remain at stealth genre and just rule at Action/Stealth kingdom. I was never thinking that IO is going to develop a sequel for Kane and Lynch.

Kayne and Lynch Dog Days is just ordinary and even bad. Like the previous game, here we face repetitive action flow in most of levels. Developers have tried to refresh the game flow by defining some action scenarios like shooting from a flying heli or scorting a car but num. of these scenes are very low and they can't help. Shooting machanic does'nt feel good again just like KL1. Enemy AI is awful and It does'nt try to challange player through the appropriate way like flanking, changing cover to get some better position or trying to get player out of his cover; they just wait for player to peek cover to start shooting him. In some of the levels, there are encounters which player faces so many enemies and because of AI system. it just turns into a frustrating battle. The only innovating element of the game is its camera which would seem very intresting, but after a few minutes, the feel of interest will be replaced with headache because of its shake and noises.

Kane and Lynch characters may seem attractive at the first place. I know people who say they like Kane and Lynch serie just because of their characters. But good characters need room in a good story to act and shine. Both Kane and Lynch games have very simple and repetitive story so there's no chance for characteriztion. Honestly, I really don't know why some of gamers like Kane and Lynch characters, because except some cool visual elements, Kane is an ordinary criminal who loves his daughter and Lynch is a crazy idiot partner who always makes trouble.

After all things I wrote, you better know that Kane and Lynch 2 has an online mode too with some interesting modes, and you can also play coop throuhg main campaign with another player which sounds great. But unfortunately, there are no online players most of time and unless you have some friends in this game to play with, you won't be able to try the online or coop mode.

Final word, just try IO's hitmans and enjoy them because there's nothing precious in Kane and Lynch waiting for you.

reviewText: TL;DR ♥♥♥♥ story. Sickening camera bob. No blood - censored faces when headshot. Useless allies. Useless cover. Limited mobility (and therefore view/protection) when in cover. Useless graphics settings. Dead multi-player.\n\nStory is worse than the first one and it takes about as long to beat. Screen shakes enough to give anyone motion sickness whenever you're moving (and sometimes when you're just trying to shoot from cover). There's no blood, just blurred out faces. You can't switch your allies' weapons manually like you could in the first one, so a lot of the time they just have a pistol or SMG when you're fighting guys with rifles. However, they do have ammo (though they don't seem to shoot a lot and, when they do, they miss 95% of the time) and, when they run out, they pick up a weapon. Multi-player is dead, so the DLC is useless, but it sounds like it would be fun for probably longer than the story took to beat if people played it. Aiming is terrible, although you don't shoot the cover you were hiding behind as much as the first one, you do sometimes shoot it. There's a lot of cover that's breakable and after breaking, the AI will move to a different cover, giving you some time to shoot them. Although it seems like the AI could shoot you through most, even unbreakable, cover, so the cover is mostly useless. Moving along cover just didn't happen - most of places you could use cover was right at the end of an object, which isn't the best if you can't see the enemy from that spot. If you wanted to move along the object, you had to get out of cover and run to the other end of the object where you could use cover again. There are some graphics settings that are supposed to make the game better to look at, but nothing seems to make it look better. Pretty much just like any other third-person shooter with a short, poorly-written story.

reviewText:
So... This is my review for Kane And Lynch 2 Dog Days: 61% / 100%

Gameplay: Well the gameplay is smooth I should say. Typicall TPS-Action shooter, but it plays fast in terms of taking cover, getting out of cover, shooting, running with camera action following you eveywhere.
That's what made the game so excited while playing.
Not even mentioning the weapons (there are pistols/assault rifles/shotguns and even a minigun in later missions.)
But it is afterall, repetitive while you are reaching half of the game. (7/10)

Gameplay Styles: Multiplayer is probably dead. So count that one out.
Offline, you can complete the story missions in 4 difficulties (Easy-Medium-Hard-Extreme) which will give you 6-12 hours of gametime assuming, you try 2 difficulties. (4/10)

Graphics: The graphics are not any type of special but they are well organized for a cover-based action TPS game.
I'm talking about the weather, and other obstacles in every map. (5/10)

Sounds: Weapon sounds are loud and clear for each weapon catagory.
Characters-Wise , you hear them talking during missions which is nice even when you shoot or take cover. (6/10)

Cover System: The cover system is well done, in levels of Max Payne series if you would. If you like a fast-paced and short action tps game with cover system, this is your game. (8/10)
P.S even when you are down and hit, you can actually slide and shoot until you get up and take cover again.

A.I: Your Side - Well it's not exactly A.I it's just one guy who's helping you alongside the campaign.
He's shooting/taking cover exactly when nessecary and sometimes he will save your ♥♥♥. I got no complains against the A.I in this game.
Enemy Side - The A.I in Medium Difficult where challenging. I did die multiply times in a mission even tho I'm a great shooter.. So Imagine playing in Extereme Difficulty..
I see the A.I a big part of this game, that's why I'm giving this section a (8.5/10)

Enjoyment: (7/10) - It is fun to play for an hour or two but gets repetetive real quick.
Repetetive: (6.5/10)
Frustraiton (3/10) - Except for few unnessecary deaths.. I'm good.
Boredom (2/10)

reviewText: This gritty, new-age, third person shooter brings Shanghai to life in a brand new way. You really begin to attach yourself to these characters, whether its lovable Kane, the tough guy with the heart of gold, or that wacky Lynch the comedic relief of this otherwise serious game. All in all its the best game i have ever played. (2.5/10)

reviewText:
It's not a game for everyone. It's meant to be sickening, disturbing and played in one go.
I wouldn't recommend it if you haven't played the first part, it would be a bit confusing and it wouldn't have the same impact.

Gameplay wise it's just a straight up cover shooter, short one at that. Nothing new, nothing special.

Story wise, it follows upon Dead Man and continues to show the decadence of crime life and it's consequences.
It's a charcter driven game, and if you don't enjoy that kind of thing, you won't enjoy the game.

Co-Op is fun and if you can get two copies for you and your friend to have one rollercoaster night of violence and drama, go for it.

Multiplayer from Dead Man and Dog Days kinda paved the way for Payday, but it's dead now. Was fun at launch, great concept.

Try it if you enjoyed darker crime movies, like Heat for example.

reviewText:
So... This is my review for Kane And Lynch 2 Dog Days: 61% / 100%

Gameplay: Well the gameplay is smooth I should say. Typicall TPS-Action shooter, but it plays fast in terms of taking cover, getting out of cover, shooting, running with camera action following you eveywhere.
That's what made the game so excited while playing.
Not even mentioning the weapons (there are pistols/assault rifles/shotguns and even a minigun in later missions.)
But it is afterall, repetitive while you are reaching half of the game. (7/10)

Gameplay Styles: Multiplayer is probably dead. So count that one out.
Offline, you can complete the story missions in 4 difficulties (Easy-Medium-Hard-Extreme) which will give you 6-12 hours of gametime assuming, you try 2 difficulties. (4/10)

Graphics: The graphics are not any type of special but they are well organized for a cover-based action TPS game.
I'm talking about the weather, and other obstacles in every map. (5/10)

Sounds: Weapon sounds are loud and clear for each weapon catagory.
Characters-Wise , you hear them talking during missions which is nice even when you shoot or take cover. (6/10)

Cover System: The cover system is well done, in levels of Max Payne series if you would. If you like a fast-paced and short action tps game with cover system, this is your game. (8/10)
P.S even when you are down and hit, you can actually slide and shoot until you get up and take cover again.

A.I: Your Side - Well it's not exactly A.I it's just one guy who's helping you alongside the campaign.
He's shooting/taking cover exactly when nessecary and sometimes he will save your ♥♥♥. I got no complains against the A.I in this game.
Enemy Side - The A.I in Medium Difficult where challenging. I did die multiply times in a mission even tho I'm a great shooter.. So Imagine playing in Extereme Difficulty..
I see the A.I a big part of this game, that's why I'm giving this section a (8.5/10)

Enjoyment: (7/10) - It is fun to play for an hour or two but gets repetetive real quick.
Repetetive: (6.5/10)
Frustraiton (3/10) - Except for few unnessecary deaths.. I'm good.
Boredom (2/10)

reviewText:
Quick Summary: Kane & Lynch 2 is a superior product to the first game, not just with the improved graphics and arcade mode, but also with Steam achievements and co-op campaign play. It’s still inferior to Max Payne 3, but you should enjoy the experience. Note that the game is extremely short, and multiplayer is dead.

Once again, you play one of the dysfunctional anti-heroes Kane or Lynch (which character you play switches during the campaign) and this time around you’re dealing with crime lords and corrupt officials in Shanghai. Both Kane and Lynch are bad dudes, so you’re not trying to clean up the streets, you just want to do your dirty work without being crushed by your powerful enemies. Despite the grittiness and ultra-violence in the story, the game is still censored for some reason. When you perform a headshot, the dead guy has his head pixelated. This appears to be a stylistic choice because there’s blood and gore everywhere, not to mention non-stop cursing.

Just like Kane & Lynch 1, the game is played in third person and you run around blasting rival gangsters and taking cover to regenerate your health as needed. The bullets are flying everywhere, so you take cover or you’ll die. By the way, even on easy mode you die pretty fast in this game if you’re up close to the enemy. Don’t think you can just run up to everyone just because you have the difficulty set low. Just like in the first game, you can find all sorts of weapons dropped by your enemies, some good and some bad. In the multiplayer, guns you pick up have like half a clip of ammo, but in the campaign you can go through the levels picking and choosing what you want to use. Unlike the first game, you cannot request more ammo from your team mates.

Pros:
+Decent graphics and storyline.
+The Fragile Alliance multiplayer mode is kind of fun, too bad nobody is playing online anymore. At least you can play it in Arcade mode with bots as team mates. Work together to grab cash, then turn on them so you can get it all!

Cons:
-Very short game. Maybe less than 5 hours for the campaign.
-Nobody online to co-op with or play heists with.

Overall if you got this game in the bundle with Kane & Lynch 1, give it a try because it’s better than the first game. It won’t blow you away though.

reviewText:
Kind of spoilers?

Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days.

Such a pretty game. Had such potential, but the length of the campaign itself hinders what could have been a great game.
I mean, Kane and Lynch.
A self serving ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ who cares only about what he wants and
the other one is a psychopathic killer but still happens to be a bit of a softie on the inside.

The story on this game revolves around mistakes. As a lot of mistakes were made by Kane and Lynch and those lead up to a ton of killings. But that's what you came here for right?
Yeah. It is.
You get to shoot a lot of people and basically ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ up.

BUT. THE LENGTH. FFS. I wanted it to be longer.

You could extend the gameplay with the arcade mode (something i wished that the first game had cause i liked Kane and Lynch: Dead men better than this game) or you could try your luck at Co-op play.

They added in DLC's and oh..steam achievements so you can spend more time with the game so it won't seem so short.
Pick it up on a sale and try it out, i'm keeping it installed and playing it from time to time cause it has the arcade mode.
Feels like a third person version of Payday: The Heist.

Overall, i really wish it were longer like i wished Kane and Lynch: Dead Men was longer.
I give this one 7/10 cause even if it was short, it was a sweet ride.





(I'm guessing the Chopper ending for Dead Men was canon then, eh?)

reviewText:
Despite quite a short campaign with a fairly abrupt ending, this game is still worth playing because of its co-operative mode.
The visual style is very dark and dreary, as if filmed from a low-end camcorder in the hands of a novice journalist documenting the exploits of an ex-mercenary and his unmedicated psychotic best friend, complete with light flaring, grainy image and mosaic censoring out headshots and nudity.

The co-op campaign is interesting enough as-is, but the game also comes in a co-operative/backstabbery multiplayer flavor called 'Fragile Alliance' where teammates rob a cache of money and compete to try to make it out with the most cash. Everyone starts out as friends and teammates, but at any moment any player could decide to betray the alliance, to try to keep his share for himself and not split it. This fact keeps the multiplayer very dynamic and tense, and you have to keep an eye over your shoulder constantly, as any of your teammates could decide to shoot you in the back, given the opportunity. The multiplayer is, in that way, just as vicious as the campaign.

The game isn't without flaws, the campaign is fairly short and ends pretty suddenly, and the story may be lacking in some departments. But it's still a solid title for people itching to play something with a friend. As opposed to the first game, this title can be played in co-op online.

The gameplay is fairly standard third person cover shooter with pretty entertaining gunplay and cool effects.

All in all I recommend a buy. It's 9,99€ so if you want a good co-op experience, do pick it up.

reviewText:
Well, I would have said they just didn't have the time or money to make this properly. But they made one before it... and it was just as bad. I'm not really sure what they're thinking... it must sell to some large group of idiots or something. The bad guys run around like headless chickens and appear and disappear all over things. Like briefly on top of a box, suddenly behind a car, at the top of stairs suddenly at the bottom. They can be anywhere, and you won't be able to hit them because the accuracy of your gun really sucks. So shooting a lot and having very limited ammo and having erratic NPC behavior is not fun at all.

Also, the cutscenes have overly shaky cam. Why? I have no idea, I mean it's super shaky, so bad that i can't even stand to look at it. It's horrible, like you have a disease or something... who thought that was a good idea?

They didn't put any thought into this, no quality control, no polish... it's a game that is still in beta. Don't bother buying it unless you really like being annoyed.

reviewText:
I want to start by saying that I absolutely loved the first game. I'd heard bad things about it, but wanted to play it for myself and give it a chance to stand on its own.

IMHO, this game is terrible. The story is nonsensical. It seems to try and be gritty for the sake of it. Its extremely clunky! It seems to play far worse than the first game, which to be honest also had some flaws in regards to smooth gameplay. It all feels slapped together hastily and in the most wonky way possible. I was shocked that it was made by the same team from the first game.

I got it on sale a while back for around $3 I think. I beat it in one sitting, and I unlocked a slew of achievements that were just handed to the player, well because. I didn't do anything special, just obtained achievements for playing the game. I don't feel that a game should be measured based on how long it is, but I really can't honestly say my 3.7 hours was 'fun'. I finished it just for the sake of doing so, and because of how much I loved the first game.

If you are curious about Kane & Lynch, play the first game. If you are interested in playing multiplayer, then 'maybe' play this one? I didn't play the multiplayer, but it does look like it offers some decent fun with interesting modes. You may also like this game if you love shakey-cam...seriously, this game is Shakey-cam and Camera Filters 2: Dog Days -_-

What happened IO Interactive? What happened? :(

Pros: Kane & Lynch are interesting characters overall
Some of the sound effects are decent
The voice acting is fairly good
Some of the environments are pretty awesome

Cons: Terrible cover system
Really really really bad gunplay
AI so stupid, it made my head hurt! Or maybe it was-
The shakey-cam...seriously, too much shaking
Very short with a stupid ending thrown in for good measure

reviewText:
Kane and Lynch are back in this sequel and it is improved. While the story still doesn't deliver, the game is a big improvment from its previous version. This tyme around we play as both main characters from the games.
Everything was repolished and improved in this sequel. The enemy AI is not good here, however the damage you take from getting hit have increased and the game will throw tons of enemies at you all the time. Now you need to be careful not to get hit, because 4 to 5 shots from an automatic gun will take you down on normal difficulty. The graphics have increased drasticaly and the good cover system is back with even more destruction.
It is obvious that the sequel has the same concept as the previous game, but this time around the overall story and feeling of the game is much darker. You will find really disturbing scenes and crazy new ideas the developers used to make a great experience.
Don't worry about multiplayer, because this time around it works. However you won't find many people playing this game. But once you gather a group the multiplayer mods are really enjoyable. Such as cops and crooks.
The different levels of difficulty and new achivments will make you want to come back to replay some levels you unlock. However, one of the annoying aspects of the game is the camera system. The default camera system is aweful. It will shake a lot when you run or fire the weapons, they try to make the game more realistic but it just gets extreamlly annoying not to be able to shoot your enemies because of it. Thankfully there is an option to tun off this shakey camera system, which improves the gameplay a lot. This time around the weapons have some good weight and feel good to fire. Alhtough they are not very accurate and one can't simply click the mouse button like crazy, they still feel good to use.
Overall this sequel is an improvment over the first game with an even darker feel and good combat. The game is still short but fun.

Good:

- The mood of the game and overall feel
- Improved difficulty
- Voice acting and characters
- Great Multiplayer (if you can find a match)

Bad:

- Shakey camera system, even in cutscenes
- Censored head shots and nudity (with pixels)
- Again the game is too short (4-5 hrs. to finish on normal in Single Player mode :/)

76/100

reviewText:
As a Dane who loved the original HitMan from Danish IO Interactive I also eventually decided to like the original Kane & Lynch Dead Men. I didn't want to buy this title at full price due to the mixed review but years after i picked up Dog Days on a discount from Steam.

In my view there are two original aspects in the game - the shaky cam and the brutal nude-level. You can either love or hate it but at least it's not medicore or generic like the rest of the game. There is so much wasted potential in this unsatisfying game.

You will hate the generic enemies coming at you in endless waves and if you have played the original the missed oppotunity in regards to the story will be down right insulting. Actually the story is insulting even compared to a generic shooter as the ending sets a new standard for 'worst ever'.

While the original also had broken game mechanics you came to accept this as a 'factor' in the fights. In Dog Days it's even worse. At the end of the day I'm sad to say the game is not worth your time.

reviewText:
Rating 6.5/10 Recommend at discount
Overview: Third Person Shooter

The Good:

+ The only thing that I can say is good is Arcade mode. A mode in which you and 7 npc's rob a location and then proceed to the extraction point fighting off police. The cool thing is you can kill your own partners and collect their money at the expense of everybody turning on you. The mode features different maps to play on, some easier than others.


The Average

The single player campaign is woefully average, from the graphics to the gameplay to the design, nothing about it stands out. The game has a filter to give the appearance that its being filmed by a cheap video camera, apparently this is suppose to make the game 'edgy' but in reality its incredibly annoying. The good news however is that you can turn this filter off. Technically the graphics are good giving you plenty of graphical options to play with yet artistically the game is boring, every level looks and feels the same and no risk or creativity was taken with the level design. In a third person shooter you need interesting set pieces to keep things fresh and engaging and this game has none of that. Every level plays out exactly the same way, enter a room, kill wave of enemies and proceed to the next area...rinse and repeat until the game is over. One aspect the campaign got right was your AI companion is actually useful and is pretty effective in combat, something that I rarely see in games these days, most AI companions are either incompetent, bullet sponges or distractions. The other positive thing I can say is that the campaign is short so you don't have to suffer through mediocrity for too long.

The character Kane and Lynch are decently written but nothing really makes them stand out among the other generic videogame characters in the same genre.

The Bad:

Multiplayer is dead as usual, shame, because if arcade mode is anything to go by, multiplayer looks like fun.


Conclusion

I never played Kane and Lynch before, the first one requires GFWL...so yeah... and this game did little to impress me. There are plenty of other great third person shooters on Steam worth your attention and money. This is a game you play when you have no other games to play. Worth purchasing at a steep discount.
voteText: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game... Just... Eh. I don't know if it's because I never played the first one and I'm missing a lot of backstory or what. But to put it bluntly, this game sucked terribly. The Arcade mode is okay, I can say that.

Story mode of this game was just terrible, awful, atrocious. Aside from the fact it was extremely short (3.5-4 hours) there were no real quality elements to draw you in. It was more like an arcade mode with some attempt at a story. None of the story brought you in or got you engrossed in the characters or what was happening. Mostly, it was just a run-and-gun game.

I was honestly surprised when after just four hours into the game the credit were rolling.

Overall, this game is disappointing and not worth it at all. If you want to play a game like this, but better and with a good story I'd recommend getting Sleeping Dogs.

reviewText:
A nauseating experience even with the horrendous camera effects disabled. Most firefights are orchestrated behind cover, turning the game into a cakewalk even on the hardest difficulty coupled with truly putrid graphics and engine glitches that turn even a modest playthrough into a bug-ridden train-wreck.

The gunplay is awful, with most weapons having the realistic accuracy of an episode of Operation Repo with a multiplayer element that is actually worse then the first game.

And that's just the gameplay. Kane and Lynch are a couple of morally bankrupt ♥♥♥♥♥♥s and the story is a ♥♥♥♥ show from start to finish with no rhyme or reason to the chaos and sensless logic of our main leads.

The only redeeming qualities are the COOP (preferably while done drunk) and the (praise the lord) laughably short lengh. There is nothing fun about this game! The entire experience went by like the worst day at school and my only regret is that I should have spent the paultry sale price on a decent BLT.

Spend your money elsewhere, hell, spend it on Hitman Absolution. You can rightfully execute both Kane and Lynch who make a cameo a couple times in the main game. That's a great selling-point in my book.

reviewText:
I thought I had experienced it all. F.E.A.R 3, X-Blades, Resident Evil: Operation Racoon City, but none of those games were nearly as bad as Kane and Lynch 2.
It has all the worst elements of bad video games:
-a non existent story with two very boring chacters Kane: The boring guy and Lynch: ARGAAHAHARGH
-bad gunplay with half the guns being terrible and the other half being so good they are broken
-enemy ai that goes between ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and aimbot in a matter of a second
-one of the most sickening artstyles ever with the discion to make the players viewpoint that of a camera following the player complete with pixilation and sound distortion which just wobbles back and forth when you sprint and makes you sick
-enemies that spawn out of corners like Time Crisis and just knock you over and insta death you
-bugs
-bad netcode.
I thought I had played some of the worst games ever but this blows those out of the water with how bad it is. Usually at least when a game is bad I can find something funny about it to make it entertaining. This game is just painful to play with it's only saving grace being that it ends before you decide to shoot yourself.
I give this game a ♥♥♥♥in Disgusting Dog ♥♥♥♥/10.
Not even worth playing if it was free.

reviewText:
The game is a good time waster for about an hours worth of gaming.
It has a very vague storyline that fails to immerse the audience completley, as well as lacking depth and meaning to the story. The quick paced storyline on the otherhand provides quite a bit of a challenge for the player willing to take the 'Extreme' difficulty.
Yet having stated that; I still feel like the game had aimed high, and failed to even shoot in terms of making a memorable shooter.
A game worth playing if you are bored and bought it on sale, yet a time waster for those seeking endless hours of fun (yes, including the very buggy and badly designed multiplayer).
A 5/10 all in all, just out of sheer easiness for me to wrap up all achievements in a rough rushed hour and 45 minutes of gameplay :/
~Husgy

reviewText:
If you find this game under 5€, and don't mind shaking camera, you'll enjoy it.
It pretty much solves all problems of KL1, except lenght.

Great thing about this game is the atmosphere and feel. It's so evil and dark. Rough.
Characters are very well designed, once you know them you are never going to forget them.
Cover system works very well.
Graphics is absolutely amazing. Plus the camera effect. Its simply amazing.
Also sound is great. There is no music, however you will never miss it. There is always something happening, including sounds.
Game is very challanging on hardcore difficulty. Actually, its almost impossible. But enjoying.

Well, its a great game. I completed it about three times, the replayability is good (since you can skip all cutscenes, the game tells you story on-foot).
+perfect gamepad support

reviewText: I don't get why most people hate this game. I just finished it and I think it's really cool for what it is. The levels look great. The characters and the voice acting are awesome. And I actually like the shaky cam and the gritty digital camera look. The only downside to the game is, that it is very short (you can finish it in under 5 hours). reviewText: This game only took 3 hours to complete, that being said I only paid $2.50 for it so it meets my value requirements. The cover system is a little wonky but I didn't have much trouble with it, only got me killed a few times.  Your allies have the aim of a 5 year old attempting to fire a S&W 500 but is also an unkillable bullet sponge so I think thats a balance thing.\n\nThis game gets more hate than it deserves, did the develpers mail it in? reviewText:
I love Kane and Lynch, don't get me wrong.
Everything about the game itself is appealing and really well done.
This is the second chapter in a third-person shooter franchise made by the creators of Hitman.
It is gritty, it is vulgar and it is relentless.

Most of the issues people complain about are the cinematic effects the developers chose.
Which admittedly after awhile I did get nauseous, but you can turn it off in the settings menu.
The most I can describe it is that the camera moves as you move.
The idea was they wanted to give you the sense that you were being followed by a guy holding a camera.
It's a cool concept and it was innovative going even further with blurred out ultra-violence...
And I get that the dev's wanted a sense of realism and immersion.
But such type of immersion hurts. Alot.

Anyway, it's the port I have a real issue with.
You see I have 184 products in my account and none of them have any issues launching...
None except this one.
It will get the start menu and crash upon clicking anything.
I have to disable my internet connection if I want to play the game.
That is really, really lame and there is 100% no excuse for such a thing.
I will be uninstalling this as soon as I am done and never playing again.

Gameplay 8/10
Game on PC 5/10

reviewText:
When I first started playing this I quit within 10 minutes. The shooting feels so bad, I can't describe it. After that first person I tried to give it 2 more chances. Same thing happened.
So then I avoided it, until recently. I don't know why, but I started to give it another try.
The story is pretty cool and the voice acting is simply brilliant, like the first game. The game is detailed, but not in a high def sort of way. That's because the camera is being used as a playable YouTube video. Messy headshots will get blurred, as well as naked bodies, and the camera will move like someone is directly following you around with one.
It's a really cool idea, but there are a lot of shakycam shots.
The shooting still feels terrible. They might've done that to artificially lengthen the game, I don't know (it's about 3,5 hours long), but it sometimes takes minutes to take down a couple of guys that would normally take you mere seconds. It's really frustrating.
Overall, it's an ok game.

[Rating: 67/100]

reviewText:
I never was able to play the first game in the series, and went into this game knowing nothing about it or its background.

I can't say very much for the story. It is violent, but I can't get a hold of the story. I'm a believer that you should be able to glean even a bit of story if you jump into a sequel, but there is none of that here. It almost seems as if you're just re-enacting a bunch of gunfight scenes from a bunch of different movies.

One thing I noticed is that a lot of the game seems similar to those 'carnival-style' games where you have to shoot the ducks as they pop up behind obstacles.

Another criticism I have is the lack of jumping. You have to crouch, then press a combination of forward and uncrouch. It's a 21st century 3D game, how hard is it to add jumping over obstacles?

The graphics are fairly good, but I hate the way the camera moves. I get that its supposed to be mimicking a handheld camera, but it really goes over the top, and it makes it very hard to play the game.
Also, the very-close over the shoulder angle is very difficult to play by.

As for sound design, I found that in some of the cutscenes the background sounds were loud enough to encroach on the spoken words, and I had to rely on subtitles.

I just don't think this is very much of a game. I guess if you're a fan of the series you might be able to make more out of it, but to me it just seems awful.

reviewText:
Not sure why this game gets so much hate. Sure, if I had paid a lot for it, 3.5 hours of single player content is simply not enough. Pick this up in the bargain basement however, and that's 3.5 hours of highly stylised adult entertainment, that feels like playing a movie.

Graphics look highly original and stylised (but only with full screen effects left on) and the gun play does feel good, once you realise that SMG and Shotguns are next to worthless and that headshots are king.

The compression artefacts are overdone, as well as the shaky cam when running. In the last level this actually made me feel a little ill. However I found the cam when walking etc to be great, and it felt like a movie.

If you are looking for a quick, violent adult experience that plays a little like the child of Gears of War and a Quentin Tarantino movie, this is for you. Wouldn't pay more then £5 for it though! 7/10.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Vastly superior to the first game, what this game lacks in plot it makes up for with its impression of constant forward progression and connectivity between levels. Unlike the first game, this time you play through as the more interesting of the two, Lynch (until the final level, for no clear reason), and it's more of a typical AAA third-person cover-shooter. The constant shaky-cam will likely make you feel ill after a while (imagine your average 'running' shaky-cam when you walk, and multiply that by 4 when you run in this game), but it's not too bad as to be unplayable. There's no team management like the first, but Dog Days give you far more interesting visuals, locations (if you like a Chinese aesthetic) and set-pieces (the standout moment of playing a full level compltely naked after being tortured). This game is by no means ground-breaking, but if you like the genre you won't find anything too offensive here.

reviewText:
I have been playing games for about 15 years now. I have played games from pretty much all genres. During the 15 years, I have played some fantastic titles like Shadow of the colossus, Dark souls and Resident evil 4. However, the gaming industry also has a dark side. And from the deepest pits of hell itself comes Kane and lynch 2, one of the worst games I have ever played.

This game is an absolute disaster. I don't see anything good in this. The story, characters, levels, weapons, cover mechanics and pretty much everything else is pure ♥♥♥♥. But the worst thing of all, is the camera. The visual effects are so bad that after playing this for 2 hours, my eyes started to hurt.So besides all the mental damage this game caused, it also attempted to make me blind.

Overall, I hate this game. The only score I can give to a catastrophe like this is a 1 out of 10. If a game physically assaults you while you play it, can you REALLY give it anything above that? The only part I enjoyed about this game was uninstalling it. What an absolute ♥♥♥♥ing trainwreck

reviewText: Kane and Lynch 2 is the sequel to Kane and Lynch which i thought was a pretty decent title. But will you want to play the sequel ? in Kane and Lynch 2 we don't play as Kane but we play as Lynch. After the events in the first game Lynch moves to Shanghai where he settles down with a woman and does minor jobs to get money. But then he needs one man to do a Arms Deal with a local crime boss. So he calls on Kane. Kane is desperete for money so he accepts. After the visit they do one minor job which ends with the crime bosses daughter dying and the entire criminal underground trying to kill them both. So how is Kane and Lynch 2 ? This game gives me mixed feelings. Where i feel steam should give me an option to give it a middle score. I dont feel the game is bad but its not good either. The gameplay is standart third person stuff. Run take cover and kill anyone in sight but it gives it own twist on the genre. The game is shown through a found footage style deal. Where you feel you are being followed by a camera man and i really like this unique approach. But for people with motion sickness dont worry cause the game lets you to disable the shaky cam.\nGraphiclly the game is bleak in color. The only color you see is from street signs which are all neon pink and purple. The game also is incredibly short. I finished the game in 2 hours and ending is one of the worst endings i have ever seen in my entire life. But theres also a multiplayer aspect to the game and that is really fun. I played in on consoles but the sad thing is you need friends to play MP on pc cause i couldnt find any games. Overall Kane And Lynch 2 Dog Days isnt a bad game but its not good either. I would reccomend getting it at a discount and not full price. I give Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days a 6.5/10

reviewText:
Not sure why this game gets so much hate. Sure, if I had paid a lot for it, 3.5 hours of single player content is simply not enough. Pick this up in the bargain basement however, and that's 3.5 hours of highly stylised adult entertainment, that feels like playing a movie.

Graphics look highly original and stylised (but only with full screen effects left on) and the gun play does feel good, once you realise that SMG and Shotguns are next to worthless and that headshots are king.

The compression artefacts are overdone, as well as the shaky cam when running. In the last level this actually made me feel a little ill. However I found the cam when walking etc to be great, and it felt like a movie.

If you are looking for a quick, violent adult experience that plays a little like the child of Gears of War and a Quentin Tarantino movie, this is for you. Wouldn't pay more then £5 for it though! 7/10.

reviewText: Vastly superior to the first game, what this game lacks in plot it makes up for with its impression of constant forward progression and connectivity between levels. Unlike the first game, this time you play through as the more interesting of the two, Lynch (until the final level, for no clear reason), and it's more of a typical AAA third-person cover-shooter. The constant shaky-cam will likely make you feel ill after a while (imagine your average 'running' shaky-cam when you walk, and multiply that by 4 when you run in this game), but it's not too bad as to be unplayable. There's no team management like the first, but Dog Days give you far more interesting visuals, locations (if you like a Chinese aesthetic) and set-pieces (the standout moment of playing a full level compltely naked after being tortured). This game is by no means ground-breaking, but if you like the genre you won't find anything too offensive here.

reviewText:
07-Mar-2016 : Finished main story
Equipment : MSI GT80-2QE Notebook

REVIEW :
This game has potential to be a great game, but several issues plagued it. It has good cinematic experience, really intense action/adventure like Die Hard movie. The problem is all your weapons have terrible accuracy except the handgun! This make the Extreme Difficulty really really hard to beat because you have to get headshot for quick 1 shot kill. The enemy on the other hand have really good accuracy and health too. So imagine how frustrating it is to beat the game on Extreme.

Story is short, i think it's shorter than the 1st one. The first half of the game is great, but the 2nd half kind of boring. You basically just have to beat waves after waves of enemies. It's like the developers ran out of story and just want the gameplay to be longer than the story itself. As for technical problems, none that I encountered.

CONCLUSION :
Recommended on sale price.
