voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I may not suggest this.

Please note I am only talking about my single-player experience, I have no opinion on the multiplayer/co-op modes what-so-ever
This has you going through the city of Shanghai on a way to make a last deal for Kane and try and save Lynch's girlfriend.
There isn't really too much else to the story other than that.

In the gameplay, it relies heavily on a cover system that at times can be very flawed. The controls for going up to a cover spot need to be precise or else:
a)You don't get in the cover or
b)You yet on the wrong side of the cover for enemies to shoot at you or
c)You are in cover facing a way you shouldn't be and you can be shot at, yet cannot if you turn around.
It also seems to have to many shots to kill people, but I can probably write that of to my lack of skill more than anything.

Along with that some of the voice-overs/animations seems to be used too much. For example it seems to have 1 animation to slide open doors, 1 for helping up your partner.
The voiceovers seem to just be on loop at some point because I always keep hearing Kane asking where I was, Lynch yelling at the enemies not to mess with him. I get that this might have been trying to create a more emirsive experience (people checking if their partner is there to insure that they are not being sneaked up on, tension snapping, etc.) but it just seems a little bit too repetive at times.

The only debatably good thing I can say about this game is the art style. It seems to set the colours darker to try to make for a more serious tone, and brightens up the lights to contrast their movement in more urban areas.
Even with this though I still have a problem with how it does the running sequence. When you start running, the screen starts to get reaally blurry (no this isn't because of my low end pc, this is an intended design choice). My problem with this is that you might be trying to get to another point away from enemies but because of this you might not see another enemy in front of you until it's too late.

I would suggest that people avoid this game for now.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
At the risk of sounding like a rant, I'll like to begin with saying that there were a few elements in this game that I found attractive - especially with playing the first game by Square.  Now the beginning of this sequel had a lot of promise with it's cinematic feel and it's very realistic atmosphere - you feel like you're getting dragged into the game and caring for it's characters.  Unfortunately, this honeymoon period ends rather quickly with a very uninspired cover-shooter with a lack of fresh mechanics.  In trying to maintain realism, the game lacks any actual boss battles but this just means the gameplay is dampered by repeatedly shooting waves upon waves of generic enemies.  The camera becomes a problem in this thirdperson shooter - especially on cover mechanics where it won't shift over the left shoulder correctly at times and putting your avatar smack in the middle of the screen.  The hollywood-esque shaky camera is used often even when you begin sprinting which doesn't heighten the experience or make the action more frantic, it's just a cheap trick that invokes dizziness/confusion.

Now the main focus of this game is the story - unfortunately it's like a hollowed out action movie's plot where it begins with some buildup then quickly deteriorates into NOOOOOOOOOOO" territory.  The villians become one-offs that should just be dispatched like the hundreds of other faceless mooks rushing at you. The inbetween level voiceovers lose their charm after a few levels and 12 chapters later the game just abruptly ends with a credit screen into a return to the main menu and no actual closure.

The game had the high production values (for it's time) and the potential to be much bigger but unfortunately it falls short in my book and I couldn't recommend it to others unless they were real fans of the first game and wanted to see a continuation."

reviewText: OK, this game is not good, I mean not good at all, at least that's what all the reviews say. And they are RIGHT, at least from one point of view. I played the first Kane and Lynch and quite enjoyed it,it had a fairly good story, even though the story was very predictable, it played fairly well, it looked somewhere between ok and mediocre it was just another cover based shooter. But I still enjoyed it. But part 2 was just bad, I was able to finish the story in some 2-3 hours and the MP didnt work very well for me... I liked the art style of the game, it managed to cover a lot of the games technical shortcommings, since at times all you see is blurry visuals and video artefacts, you dont see bad textures or crappy animations. Anyway I do not recommend this game for the full price, hell even a discount of 75% still is not fully ok, I bought the game together in a package with the first one for a few euros, which still bugs me...\n\nNevertheless if it's for 1-2 E you can give it a try since it's a mediocre shooter with an interesting visual style (I'm not saying pretty) Other than that just get something else...

reviewText: Do not buy this game. Don't do it. It's not even the kind of bad that's funny. It's just flat-out bad, the kind of flat-out horrible-ness that doesn't justify playing it even if you got it for free. What's wrong with it? Everything. Camera is awful in-game and in cutscenes. Storywise, I'm not even sure what's going on. Controls are clunky, and that's being generous. Gameplay wise it's about as entertaining as repeatedly slipping in a pool of liquified crap. Cover system works about as well as a potato works for cleaning your dishes. Half the guns can't hit anything within five feet of them turning shoot-outs into a horrible process of wasting ammo in the hopes that something will hit, or charging the enemy head on and using the ol' spray and pray. Health makes little to no sense with random blots of blood splattering all over your screen to confuse you as to where the enemy attacked from and just how much health it is that you have. Overall there's about a dozen different things to plague the experience at all times to make it as much of a chore as possible to trudge through the game. Do yourself a favor, don't play it. Save your money and buy a potato or something, whatever it is it's bound to be better than this game.

reviewText:
Kayne and Lynch 2 DEFEATED!!!

What a mix of bad meets good.

Pros:

Smooth as butter gameplay on PC.
Environments look great and combat takes place in plenty of locations.
Lot's of powerful weaponry to use topped with great sound effects.
Lot's of shooting for the shoot 'em up junkie.
Partner AI Kane is actually useful and kills lot's of enemies.
Don't ♥♥♥♥ with whitey.

Cons:

Short. But I paid 5$ for it so I'm not complaining.
In one particular stage, your ability to aim is hindered by horrible cover camera angles and the crosshair being useless. How did this get pass testing?
While combat is fun, the pacing is hindered by to many enemies at certain points, bringing a sense of boredom from repetition.
The drunk camera while sprinting is wtf.

I say it's worth the 5$ on Steam if you skipped this game. Go check it out. Outside of one particular level, the game isn't bad. It just isn't anything special.

AI: 7.5/10 (got supriced the AI actually tried to flank me then in other games, which they just stand behind cover and pop up sometimes)

Overall rating from me: 6/10

And now to what i think about the game which is not a whole lot because of the numb get in the cover and shoot when the enemy pop up once in a while, and resurecting your partner. I will admit that this game is not a walk in the park as some may believe as you can easily die in this game if you're just trying to go gun blazin', which is not a good advice to do. The character per say can use a bit more character than just the crazy guy and the semi-stupid guy which just follows around for the ride. This game give the player different locations throughout Hong Kong. I dont have much more time to follow up with more of my thoughts on this but i sincerely say and hope that you dont buy this game as i did, even if you just want to shoot people for no reason in China, just buy CoD (Call of Duty) or CS (Counter Strike) instead. Well thanks for checking my rating/review of this game and i hope it will decide if its worth your purchase. Good bye and have a good time. -ZKD

reviewText:
Dog days is the sequel to Dead Men game, this time around you're in china dealing with some dangerous people Lynch calls Kane for help.

The game starts with you and Kane being tortured by the infamous 1000 cuts method with a nasty youtube camera effect and i do not mean nasty in the good way, in fact the entire game has the stupid pixelation and camera shake effects making the gameplay really unconfortable.
Also if you headshot someone his head becomes pixelated...... same goes with naked characters.

It's a shame they had to go with that idea of game style, because it really does ruin the gameplay a lot.

Don't buy this game at full price, not even during discounts, maybe if you get it from a bundle then it's ok , you can beat this game in 4 hours tops, with probably one of the laziest endings ever, less even if you're decent at third person shooters.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
A clunky, boring, uninspired disaster.

The entire game consists of running between cover and trying to kill the exact same bullets sponge enemies over and over and over again. All that changes is the look of their character model. And he shooting system is horrifically bad; machine guns will miss constantly as you fire but shotguns can pull off a surgical headshot from three rooms away. Objects have strange collision dection too, so many times you won't be able to shoot an enemy despite seeing a whole arms sticking out from behind a car's hood. It's the most bizarre hit detection I've seen in an FPS.

There's no music and virtually no story either. Kane and Lynch just run around a few corridors over an over in an attempt to pull off one last heist and retire. Obviously things go wrong early on and the remainder of the game is running from A to Z while you listen to some of the worst dialog I've ever heard in a buddy game storyline. Someone made the brilliant decision to film this game as if it were taken from Michael Bay style security footage. It's god awful and make running a chore (not to mention any time it zooms in on a character model you want to cry at how horrible the graphics are).

Stay away. I feel sorry for anyone who paid $60 when this game launched.

reviewText:
Compared to the first Kane & Lynch game, this is better in every way.

Graphics look WAY better, even though it has got lots of annoying filters.
Sound is also better, this time the voices never sound ouf of place in any way. Also, the guns sounds better as well.
The controls are not that very different from Dead Men" but this time the player is allowed to reload whenever he or she wants to do so. That's always something.
Also
date: the story is better this time around. Somewhat more interesting.\n\nOverall
recommended: it's a better game than "Kane & Lynch: Dead Men" and if you can buy this at a discounted price
hoursPlayed: you're likely to get the first game "in the deal". I had some fun with the game and I'm sure someone else would have that too."
